text: Encyclopædia Britannica, Inc. is an American company known for publishing the Encyclopædia Britannica, the world's oldest encyclopedia, and also the second largest. == Further reading == *“Encyclopædia Britannica May Refer to ‘For Sale’ to Raise Capital,” Portland Oregonian, April 7, 1995 * Richard A. Melcher, “Dusting Off the Britannica,” Business Week, October 20, 1997 * Robert McHenry, “The Building of Britannica Online” * Steve Barth, “Britannica on the Virtual Bookshelf,” Knowledge Management Magazine * Dorothy Auchter, “The Evolution of Encyclopædia Britannica,” Reference Services Review 27, no. 3: 297 == References == == Other websites == *Company website *Encyclopædia Britannica Corporate, “Company History” Category:Encyclopædia Britannica Category:Book publishing companies Category:1760s establishments in the Thirteen Colonies Category:Companies based in Chicago
